value.description: This fragile mushroom was genetically engineered to produce a silk net that is both difficult to tear and soft to the touch. While the mushroom takes a very long time to grow, only exotic ultra-tech fabrics outperform its dragonskin fibers.\n\nSome say it's called dragonskin because of its red color. Others think it owes its name to the greed it inspires in people.
Fabric spun from microfibers extracted from dragonskin mushrooms. It is very tough, good at insulating, and protects exceptionally well against flame.
Plant dragonskin, a slow-growing mushroom that yields an exceptionally tough, heat-resistant plant fiber.
